comments.raw_text:
Currently Firefox 7 scrolls at a lower frame rate than Firefox 6 with high resolution scrolling enabled.

It is likely going to be difficult to track down exactly what changed, but generally pages with a large number of images or flash elements on them are scrolling at a lower frame rate.

Is there any way for us to instrument automated metrics on our frame rate when smoothly scrolling a predetermined set of complex pages?

comments.raw_text:
>This is Win7 with acceleration on?

The test machine didn't have approved drivers, so acceleration was off.  However part of the problem is the extent to which this bug is anecdotal, is there any way for us to know how our frame rate for scrolling is changing over time?
comments.creator: faaborg@gmail.com
